ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.2.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.2'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Package 'runonce' helps automating the saving of long-running code to help running the same code multiple times. If you run some long-running code once, it saves the result in a file on disk. Then, if the result already exists, i.e. if the code has already been run and its output has already been saved, it just reads the result from the stored file instead of running the code again.

Package 'runonce' helps automating the saving of long-running code to help running the same code multiple times. If you run some long-running code once, it saves the result in a file on disk. Then, if the result already exists, i.e. if the code has already been run and its output has already been saved, it just reads the result from the stored file instead of running the code again.

name: r-runonce
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.3.3" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-runonce
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/runonce_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/runonce/runonce_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 1a85ea78f5a4ee2c4eeb5c91618aa54a17b26c2fc7b98fcc96cb658a30deb212

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-bigassertr
    - r-urltools
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-bigassertr
    - r-urltools

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('runonce')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('runonce')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/privefl/runonce
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: Package 'runonce' helps automating the saving of long-running code to help running the same code multiple times. If you run some long-running code once, it saves the result in a file on disk. Then, if the result already exists, i.e. if the code has already been run and its output has already been saved, it just
    reads the result from the stored file instead of running the code again.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - pettyalex

# Package: runonce
# Title: Run Once and Save Result
# Version: 0.2.3
# Authors@R: person("Florian", "Prive", role = c("aut", "cre"), email = "florian.prive.21@gmail.com")
# Description: Package 'runonce' helps automating the saving of long-running code to help running the same code multiple times. If you run some long-running code once, it saves the result in a file on disk. Then, if the result already exists, i.e. if the code has already been run and its output has already been saved, it just reads the result from the stored file instead of running the code again.

# Encoding: UTF-8
# RoxygenNote: 7.1.1
# Imports: bigassertr, urltools
# Suggests: testthat (>= 2.1.0), covr
